website_summaries.verdict: The Caldigit USB-C Pro Dock is a well-built, full universal Thunderbolt 3 and USB-C docking station that offers all the ports you need to create a full desktop experience for a laptop, whatever its connection type.

customer_reviews.title: Just works - beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Fantastically good docking station. Sits very neatly un I now have a single thin usb-c cable to plug into my 13"mbp which connects 2 nice 21" screens, a keyboard, ethernet & usb hd and it charges the laptop at full speed. Plus there's an sd card slot and a couple of usb sockets on the front for any other devices I might use. On the mac there was nothing to set up or install - it just worked. Only downside - the very bright blue led on the front required a very small piece of black electrical tape to hide it - tape is hardly noticeable now.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gould

customer_reviews.title: Dual USB-C and Thunderbold make it futureproof best dock for Surface devices
customer_reviews.text: So I have SurfaceBook 2 and surface dock witch is very unreliable. So had been looking for dock witch I can use today and once I upgrade my machine keep using and this one is the only on the market with that requirement. Device is lovely metal case witch will help with the heat. It is really plug and play. works right away. and so far working like a charm, charging my device, external screens are connected and working unlike previously, headphone jack in good position up front, ethernet is stable no disconnect or packet loss. Overall if you have any of the new Microsoft Surfaces with USB-C get this one and forget the antient surface dock.
customer_reviews.author: TA Corp UK

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, looks and feels high quality. Supplies plenty of power which is an issue for some docks. Could do with a couple more USB-A ports for maximum score. It also doesn't always seem to let my keyboard work at boot up, which is annoying. Don't know if it's the hub, the laptop or the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Alastair Maw

customer_reviews.title: Great Dock for compatibility (Thunderbold 3/USB C)
customer_reviews.text: Works great on Mac, but still allows for good enough compatibility on USB C devices. I use this dock for my home desk, where I use a MacBook Pro, a Thunderbolt enabled windows laptop and a USB C desktop. Functionality is reduced when using USB C, but it is good enough for my needs. Pros: - Great look - Backwards compatible with USB C - 2 DisplayPorts - Easy to install - SD card reader Cons: - Can get very hot - Not enough USB ports - No extra Thunderbolt ports
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Robust, works with ubuntu 18
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition - and I am very picky when it comes to peripherals. Works perfectly with my Dell xps 13 running Ubuntu, it's solidly built (encased in aluminium) as well. Good Buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Slater

customer_reviews.title: Good, but on the expensive side
customer_reviews.text: Great product and looks great, albeit a little expensive for what it is. Worked as expected, without issue. x1 additional USB port would have made this 5-star. Blue light on the front is annoying - I’ve put a sticky-back webcam cover to prevent this from bugging me.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick F

customer_reviews.title: Makes your Mac crash everyday
customer_reviews.text: Every time it goes to sleep it makes my MBP16 crash with a kernel panic.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Just what’s needed
customer_reviews.text: Simple, 1 cable solution for my MacBook Pro with loads of inputs. Dual screen output is spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely with Matebook X pro and Linux
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my Matebook X pro with Linux mint and Win 10. Scores a point over the more expensive Caldigit TS3, because this one has dual Displayport outputs for driving dual external monitors.
customer_reviews.author: HughF

customer_reviews.title: Versatile thunderbolt docking station.
customer_reviews.text: The USB drives didn't register on initial install, but immediately appeared and were accessible after restart of the laptop. All other functions operate as per product description.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pressley

customer_reviews.title: Great Docking station for Surface Pro 7 and/or MacBook Pro (USB-C)
customer_reviews.text: Has all the ports you'd need for a typical set up. Works well with both Mac and Surface Pro with USB C, both powering and connecting the devices with one cable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Will Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Solid kit at great price
customer_reviews.text: Lovely piece of kit, I have two UHD monitors running off it with no issue at all. The only issue I've had with is system forgetting what is on which monitor after screen locked then unlocked, may well not even be dock's fault.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Avoid like a rash, over priced and under engineered
customer_reviews.text: Broken after 4 months, pain in the arse to return. No customer service due to Covid.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mp Cook

customer_reviews.title: Low quality loose connections
customer_reviews.text: Gets extremely hot and connectors are “loose”. Slight movements of desk would cause monitor to momentarily loose connection or begin to strobe. Low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Driskell

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant.
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastically, allows us to hook up all our peripherals through on USB-C cable.
customer_reviews.author: Tungsten media

customer_reviews.title: Tested with Surface Pro 7/Surface Go
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use with Surface Pro 7 and Surface Go. Works great on both, power/video/other peripherlas over USB-C cable work with no issues. Would highly recommend. Please note, you must use active video cables with this device (as stated my manufacturer), so if you are having issues with no video it's probably this. The dock has 2 DisplayPort connections at back, so likely need adapter for more standard HMDI connections found in monitors/TV's.
customer_reviews.author: Natendi

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well with new MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: The dock is great - works extremely well with new MacBook Pro. Using it to connect to a 4K monitor at 60Hz, wired gigabit ethernet, USB printer and USB3 external hard drive as well as powering the Mac - all through one Thunderbolt cable. Makes desk much tidier and makes it a lot easier to unplug the Mac and move it around as well as delivering amazing speed. Expensive but worth it compared to other USB3 docks.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I researched for about 3 weeks on docks for using with my Mac and work Surface really pleased with this. Just the right number of ports and can hook up two monitors in addition to my device. Thunderbolt charging ability is worth every penny as it means you only have to plug one cable into the device of choice if it has that capability. I also wanted a horizontal dock and the finish on this one I think is great.
customer_reviews.author: AthléticoBenbow

customer_reviews.title: Fit for purpose
customer_reviews.text: Work with Mac out of the box but alway use the original power supply for the MacBook Pro other wise if you use multiple displays they will disconnect after a few hours and won’t come back on unless you reboot because the Mac does not have enough power so again plug in your macs original power supply I also would have thought this is the same for pc laptops
customer_reviews.author: Marc London

customer_reviews.title: This product killed my monitors HDMI port.
customer_reviews.text: I used a USB-C to HDMI adapter with this device and it has permanently killed the HDMI port on my monitor. This device is dangerous to your hardware do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stapleton

customer_reviews.title: Versatile add on for all laptops
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for work. Great versatile docking station for access to all laptop accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Dazzle

customer_reviews.title: Randomly stop working
customer_reviews.text: The Ethernet port randomly stops working. The only way to fix this is to replug the Ethernet cable or the power adapter of the dock.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano

customer_reviews.title: Works with Surface Book 2
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my Surface book 2 and it has work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well dressed but doesn't do what it says on the tin
customer_reviews.text: This USB C Pro-Doc is an incredibly well designed and constructed product but it does not drive my two external monitors simultaneously from my MacBook. I've tried everything and spent quite a lot of additional time and money on various active convertors and cables to get the thing to work without success so I've ended up buying two new 4K monitors that work directly from the MacBook and they even have thunderbolt and USB C outputs built-in. The Pro-Dock doesn't even have a thunderbolt output built in, I am so disappointed my expectations were high in spite of some negative comments which I have since proven incorrect. Time to return it, sadly
customer_reviews.author: Critical i

customer_reviews.title: Works a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Works absolutely brilliantly for docking my Macbook Pro to two extended desktop monitors! The previous dock I had could only do mirrored screens, and 4K at only 30 Hz. This one does two 4K 60 Hz extended desktop monitors brilliantly. It's got just the ports I need, nothing too much! Additionally, it looks quite stylish, and it's colour-matched with all my Space Grey kit. The only tiny issue is that the dock is quite light, so a stiff cable will lift it from the table. However, this is a very minor nitpick, and does not affect anything aside from desk aesthetics. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Oskari Grönroos

product_meta.title: CalDigit USB-C Pro Dock - 85W Charging, Thunderbolt 3, UHS II SD Card Slot, USB C Gen 2, USB A x 3, Dual DisplayPort 1.2, LAN, 3.5mm Audio for Thunderbolt and USB-C Computers (0.7 Meter Cable - Grey)
feature_bullets: [UNIVERSAL COMPATIBILITY] Can be used with computers with USB-C, Thunderbolt 3, or even USB-A. Perfect for IT Environments utilizing both Windows and Macs **Functionality will vary depending on host connection. Please refer to the compatibility chart for more information

[10 PORTS OF CONNECTIVITY]: 1 x Thunderbolt 3 (Backwards Compatible with USB-C), 2 x DisplayPort 1.2, 3 x USB 3.2 Type A (5Gb/s), 1 x USB-C 3.2 Gen 2 (10Gb/s Data Only), Gigabit Ethernet, UHS-II SD Card Slot (SD 4.0), 3.5mm Combo Audio Jack. **USB-C Pro Dock does not have a downstream Thunderbolt 3 port

[POWERFUL 85W LAPTOP CHARGING]: Provides up to 85W to charge your laptop and power all of your USB peripherals [STAND ALONE CHARGING] Front facing USB-A port can charge devices without being connected to a computer
[DUAL 4K EXTENDED DISPLAYS]: Connect up to two 4K@60Hz (4096 x 2160 30-bit color) monitors via DisplayPort 1.2 (**DisplayPort to HDMI/DVI/VGA adapter/cable must be an ACTIVE type.**)
[MAC & WINDOWS COMPATIBLE]: Ideal for 2016+ MacBook Pro, 2017+ iMac Pro or Windows Ultrabooks with Thunderbolt 3 or USB-C such as the Yoga, Spectre, XPS, Razer Blade

specifications.Customer reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
